question: In which year, the "African Party for the Independence of Guinea and Cape Verde (PAIGC)" founded?
explanation: The "African Party for the Independence of Guinea and Cape Verde (PAIGC)" was founded in 1956. The African Party for the Independence of Guinea and Cape Verde is a political party in Guinea-Bissau. Originally formed to a peaceful campaign for independence from Portugal, the party turned to armed conflict in the 1960s and was one of the belligerents in the Guinea-Bissau War of Independence. Towards the end of the war, the party established a socialist one-party state, which remained intact until multi-party democracy was introduced in the early 1990s.
